content.question: Two charged particles enter a region that contains a uniform magnetic field, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="true">→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The direction of the magnetic field is unknown. The two charged particles have charges <math alttext="q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and masses <math alttext="lowercase m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. The particles enter the region of magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> with the same velocity. The particle with charge <math alttext="q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> follows the solid path, and the particle with charge <math alttext="q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> follows the dashed path, as shown in the figure. Which of the following could represent the relationships between the masses and charges of the two particles and provide supporting evidence?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase m sub 1, equals 2 lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="q sub 1, equals 2 q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , as the mass increases, the centripetal force increases, and the radius of the path will decrease.

<math alttext="lowercase m sub 1, equals 2 lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="q sub 1, equals 2 q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , as the charge increases, the magnetic force increases, and the radius of the path will decrease.

<math alttext="lowercase m sub 1, equals lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="q sub 1, equals 2 q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , as the charge increases, the magnetic force decreases, and the radius of the path will decrease.

<math alttext="lowercase m sub 1, equals lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="q sub 1, equals 2 q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , as the charge increases, the magnetic force increases, and the radius of the path will decrease.

<math alttext="2 lowercase m sub 1, equals lowercase m sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="2 q sub 1, equals q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , both the centripetal force and magnetic force increase, and the radius of the path will decrease.
